title: Is Sona Mid Troll?
body: Do I deserve to get flamed in low elo (low silver) if I bring this out? I played it against riven mid, and I just poked her (with the bandit mastery) and farmed to get support items including athens. We ended up winning the game, and I did not feed by any means. The only detriment was that I could not match the roaming of the riven, so my teammates were pressured early while I could only stay mid.

Here's a Sona trick. When you have two stacks of Power Cord, you can throw out a basic attack, use Q, then throw out another basic attack. Using Q activates Power Cord, which is an auto attack reset, so it's an instant proc of Thunderlord's Decree. The best way to abuse this is to just press Q twice in fountain, then walk to lane and get an instant Thunderlord's Decree with AA+Q+AA. This is why she's an early game bully, she can get so much control just at level 1.

I see what you are saying, it lets you get all the power of AP Sona but the gold of midlane so you get the items faster.  You probably miss out on some of the crazy damage of other midlaners but that can be made up by having AP in other lanes.

You miss out on a lot of her kit's power in the laning phase but you get that power back but amplified when you start going for skirmishes and teamfights.

Her lategame is like a constant spam of 700 damage + Q-AA combos mixed with 350 + heals and tons of movementspeed constantly.

And that ultimate also deals some damage with AP.


So when someone which a massively spammable high damage ability+AA combo also brings AOE heals+barrier + speedup and a AOE stun it suddenly makes sense why people can accept the pick even if it seems weird at the start of a game.

I remember at some point doing like 1,3 k damage with a passive stacked Q-AA+lichbane+luden-thunderlord against some carry, and i could repeat it every 3 seconds (just without luden and thunderlord but still) however i was quite fed and my target was squishy.

But it still felt great^^

No, though it's a pretty poor pick overall because of the lack of waveclear it has some decent matchups like Katarina and Ziggs and it can help when you have a protect the X comp (Kog'Maw, Twitch, etc.). It became worse because of the rework that took away a lot of her early game bullying power in exchange for a ridiculous level 16 power spike, and early game bullying was generally the reason to pick Sona because her waveclear sucks late game. However, she does get solo exp and therefore gets her level 16 faster, so it's not _that_ bad.
You don't deserve to be flamed for it, it's a viable pick, but realize that more often than not there are better choices. Pick it when you have a counterpick, when your team already has some decent waveclear, and/or when someone else on your team is going to carry. You should also be good at Sona!

You have no waveclear.

Anyone halfway intelligent will just punish you by pushing you under tower.
but then they are very susceptible to ganks, the better way to deal with her mid is to freeze lane and have your jgl get free food

Except it really isn't that big of a deal to get ganked in that lane. Sona can NEVER contest your control in one of the bushes and even if you do get ganked before 6 Sona offers nothing in ganks (she loses a lot of damage if she uses the slow which means you will probably live anyway). Even after 6 Sona's range is lower than most other mid laners so it is usually pretty obvious if she is going to ult you unless she uses flash+r but even then she should theoretically never have flash since most junglers can burn her flash by looking at her even when the wave is slightly on her side (Zac E+Q will arguably do 1/3+ her health so she kind of has to flash it every time for example).

it kinda depends on sonas jungler and how well they set up and work together, a khazix jumping in while sona hits her e empowered auto lets the kha be sticky enough to make the laner regret pushing so hard.  not saying its guna be a fun time farming eith sona just thst she isnt completely defenseless

The enemy mid laner isn't going to literally sit there and be free food in your lane, though.

They're also going to push you in, roam, gank bot lane (or top), then come back. All while you're struggling to push back.

I could see this working in norms/very low elo, but even by the time you reach upper silver, players will punish you for it.

If you want to play Sona in an off meta role, I'd consider bot lane carry. With support backup, she should have much better wave control.

(Note: I still wouldn't do this in ranked.)

no, not really. Sona midlane isn't much of a trollpick, it is just way too disatvantageous in usual situations to be considered viable. you are way too fragile (less than 500 hp without runes and lowest base defence stats ingame) and have comparably high manacosts for the long cooldowns earlygame. pre-6 you are literally a found Food for any even remotely aggressive enemy laner. most of the time you as a Sona can already consider yourself challenger Level if you don't lose first blood on lvl 2 against any assassin champion there is. 

Sona mid just Spikes too slowly and too rhythmically (heh), she slowly grows power over the games duration, she has no real powerspike compared to other champions, and she scales too hard with items and has no base values whatsoever, the only Thing that is good without any items equipped is her E movement speed boost which has rather high base stats, but other than that you as a midlane Sona are pretty much fucked all the way through.
if it works it works, there is never reason to flame.  flamers are bad teamates who dont know how to adapt to meta without a redmercy or brofresco video and only want someone else to blame

Supports in different lanes are a difficult thing to pull off, but if you do, oh boy there's a reward for your team.

Sona for example, becomes a nuking monstrosity that can wipe an ADC before they can blink with a Q auto.

Nami has a good amount of burst as well as being able to heal and empower autos on allies (when the E's bonus becomes 200-300 magic damage on hit, it becomes quite unpleasant for the enemies.)

Typically supports make excellent use out of non-support items, they simply can't afford them in the support role. This often comes at the price of waveclear, however.

I have tried sona mid, rakan mid, nami mid, nami top, and soraka mid back when the Q had more range. They were all quite comical, especially soraka back in those days. You would land a Q on one enemy and heal 1/2 your hp from the bonus, as well as being able to refill allies quite easily.

I'm quite sad that they're forced down bot lane despite all of this.

Pro-play games are all about wave clear, even in bot-lane, that's why you never see Sona _support_-

But, who cares about high elo? You're in silver! You're exchanging waveclear for some insane AP Burst (can assasinate a fed ADC solo) and one of the best seige champions in game (she's also pretty good at pick). Do take note on whether you're setting your team up for failure or for success. Please don't feel like you _need_ to buy support items. Redemption is poetry on Sona, but she can easily hard carry with AP items!

Please take sona mid when I'm the event jungle.
That's my feedback

It could work in some Scenarios, but you would likely be missing a ton of CS and roaming power if you did pick Sona mid. In that elo though, you REALLY don't need to worry about roaming unless you want to pick up a few extra kills. It would be a better pick vs something like {{champion:12}} mid {{champion:105}} {{champion:30}} mid {{champion:45}} mid {{champion:143}} mid {{champion:50}} mid but all of those picks are pretty rare and . . . well, they pretty much offer more. Fizz would be good whether or not you can escape his R and stay out of range, which you should be able to. Veigar outscales, the plant bitch would be the best match up IMO. Swain will stomp the living hell out of your team early and mid game because of your lack of presense - Alistar is an extreme rare mid. Karthus, well. He's Karthus. GP scenario where he loses to everybody.

Nobody deserves to get flamed.

Now, is it troll? Probably not! The reason being is that meta in silver is different from meta in diamond (speaking from my experience in both). The most effective tactics change a lot, and Sona mid is probably just fine in silver. It sounds like you correctly understood the matchup, and you played appropriately.

People will flame anyone that does poorly in an off meta pick. But do you deserve it? Of course not, no one deserves to be flamed.

I find it hard to believe you bullied out a Riven.

Unless she was shit, she would outscale via 1 item, namely Maw. Hell, even going for flat Lethality or CDR would work.

AP Sona is squishy af and would be easily oneshot by a lvl 6 Riven. Sona's poke is also very telegraphed and easily blocked by E, and it's also low range. Once it's used, Riven has pretty much free reign for a fast combo with W.

That is, unless she was a shit Riven.
